### Horseshoe prior

A simple, one-variable Bayesian linear regression model using a horseshoe prior.

```{r linear_horseshoe_greta}
horseshoe <- function (tau = 1, dim = NULL) {
  lambda <- cauchy(0, 1, truncation = c(0, Inf), dim = dim)
  sd <- tau ^ 2 * lambda ^ 2
  normal(zeros_like(sd), sd, dim = dim)
}

# variables & priors
int  <- variable()
sd   <- inverse_gamma(1, 1)
coef <- horseshoe()

# linear predictor
mu <- int + coef * attitude$complaints

# observation model
distribution(attitude$rating) <- normal(mu, sd)
```
